urf should be a perma game mode

The problem with this is something that was already observable when the game mode was featured. People were crying for perma-bans on champions in the queue. Riot has said themselves that one of the main reasons that featured game modes arent permanent is because they don't want the data from these games to affect game balancing. Imagine being a Sona main, while URF queue is permanent, and coming to find out that they upped her cooldowns because its an "apparent problem" within the game. I don't know about you, but tailoring balance to also include URF mode (imagine the ever-growing list of perma-bans) sounds pretty crappy.

Nobody views URF as a serious gamemode. They could always, not change anything about the champions and just accept that some picks are significantly stronger than others in URF mode. That's how it is on the Howling Abyss. You don't see Katarina or Xerath nerfed because they are too strong on Howling Abyss. Besides this, they already change individuals to balance them separately on Twisted Treeline. Renekton for example was nerfed ONLY on Twisted Treeline but not on Summoner's Rift. There could be similar actions taken to URF mode.
BUT WAIT, they can change champions for certain gamemodes only you know.
Get over URF already PLEASE. Featured Game Modes return with time. They;ve already said it WILL be back next year so just wait.
NO. ITS UNACCEPTABLE. Why make us wait for a year when they could just release all the game modes as they were permanently?

I want URF as much as anyone, and am glad to see so many people clamoring for it still so Riot sees that it's not dying off in terms of demand.

That being said.. No, making 'every' game mode permanent would destroy LoL. Too many game modes means not enough people playing SR. Not enough people playing SR actually severely hurts Riot's bottom-line, which means they can't afford to maintain LoL.

That also being said.. Adding URF as a gamemode wouldn't break anything >_> Srsly Rito. Pls.

@Daithus The problem with that theory is that trolls don't disappear just because of game modes. They'd still be present, especially in lower ranking of ranked because it has the biggest impact on people.

Putting out all of the game modes would severely reduce the number of people playing SR at any given time. People like myself, who play without trolling ever; would simply migrate between game modes so frequently SR would see less play. This is fact. People would still play SR, yes; but it would be a serious hit on numbers.

As for trolls.. You can't get rid of them by giving them variety. Trolls troll because they find harming other people's good time to be fun. SR is the best place to do that, plain and simple. It's why there's less trolls in other modes generally (They're still there of course, just not as omnipresent. There's just less reason for them to troll modes that aren't taken as seriously).

I genuinely wish releasing all the game modes 'wouldn't' hurt Rito/LoL. But it would.

I'm just wondering, why are you (and by "you" I mean "Riot") making those skins Legacy?

I obviously can't say with 100% certainty, but from a marketing standpoint it makes sense:

None of these skins are at all popular anymore, I doubt hardly anyone is even buying them currently (That's not to say they're bad, just that most people who want them have them). By making them legacy they'll not only have a bunch of people buying them before the go in the vault.. They'll have more limited skins to pull out of the vault and sell, making them more popular.

It's all about making your old product more appealing to the newer masses.

P.S. I'm not saying that's a bad thing. I don't blame them, it's not some dubious horrible scheme. It's smart. I'd do it.
